metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9534 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
tif_write.c in libtiff 4.0.6 has an issue in the error code path ofTIFFFlushData1() that didn't reset the tif_rawcc and tif_rawcp members.Reported as MSVR 35095, aka "TIFFFlushData1 heap-buffer-overflow."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9534` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
